properties.name: Holmes and Watson board the Underground
properties.desc: For the singular time in the Canon, our two investigators set out to Saxe-Coburg Square near Aldersgate Station

properties.name: Holmes beats upon the pavement
properties.desc: Taking a note of the surroundings, Holmes observes that the footpath outside Mr. Wilson's pawn shop is hollow. The City and Suburban Bank is nearby

properties.name: Holmes and Watson go to the concert
properties.desc: Holmes enjoys an afternoon of listening to Sarasate before the two diverge, deciding to meet later in the evening

properties.name: Watson's House
properties.desc: Watson heads back to his house at Church Street in Kensington.

properties.name: Watson heads to Baker Street
properties.desc: Watson cuts across the park at night to meet Holmes at Baker Street, as decided

properties.name: The party depart
properties.desc: Holmes, Watson, Mr. Merryweather and Athelny Jones depart around a quarter past 10 to the Bank via hansom cabs

properties.name: Exit at Farringdon Street
properties.desc: They exit at Farringdon Street and walk the rest of the way to the bank to catch John Clay in the act

properties.name: Jabez Wilson's House
properties.desc: Mr. Wilson lives at Saxe-Coburg Square, near Aldersgate Street.

properties.name: The Offices of the League
properties.desc: Everyday, he travels to Pope's Court at Fleet Street as part of his employment

properties.name: Mr. Wilson tries to visit Duncan Ross
properties.desc: According to Leslie S. Klinger’s New Annotated Sherlock Holmes (Vol. I, p. 55), citing Donald Redmond’s A Study in Sources, a few doors down from the address given there actually was the firm of Arnold and Sons, which manufactured artificial limbs (but not kneecaps).

properties.name: Mr. Wilson visits Holmes
properties.desc: Finding Duncan Ross missing, he visits Holmes at 221B Baker Street, probably via the Underground
